text: After the plague, the Lord spoke to Moses and Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saying,
“Conduct a census of the entire congregation of the Israelites, from twenty years old and upwards, by their families, all who are able to go to war in Israel.”
So Moses and Eleazar the priest addressed them on the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho, saying,
“Take a census of the men from twenty years old and upwards, as the Lord commanded Moses.” These were the Israelites who came out of Egypt:
The descendants of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn, were: from Hanoch, the family of the Hanochites; from Pallu, the family of the Palluites;
from Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; from Carmi, the family of the Carmites.
These were the families of the Reubenites, and those counted were 43,730.
Pallu's son was Eliab.

The sons of Eliab were Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. These are the same Dathan and Abiram who were called by the assembly, who contended against Moses and Aaron in the company of Korah, when they contended against the Lord.
The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them along with Korah, when that company died, when the fire consumed 250 men, and they became a warning sign.
However, the line of Korah did not die out.
The descendants of Simeon by their families were: from Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites; from Jamin, the family of the Jaminites; from Jachin, the family of the Jachinites;
from Zerah, the family of the Zerahites; from Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.
These were the families of the Simeonites, and those counted were 22,200.
The descendants of Gad by their families were: from Zephon, the family of the Zephonites; from Haggi, the family of the Haggites; from Shuni, the family of the Shunites;
from Ozni, the family of the Oznites; from Eri, the family of the Erites;
from Arod, the family of the Arodites; from Areli, the family of the Arelites.
These were the families of the sons of Gad, and those counted were 40,500.
Judah's sons were Er and Onan, but they died in the land of Canaan.
The descendants of Judah by their families were: from Shelah, the family of the Shelanites; from Perez, the family of the Perezites; from Zerah, the family of the Zerahites.
The descendants of Perez were: from Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; from Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.
These were the families of Judah, and those counted were 76,500.
The descendants of Issachar by their families were: from Tola, the family of the Tolaites; from Puvah, the family of the Punites;
from Jashub, the family of the Jashubites; from Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.
These were the families of Issachar, and those counted were 64,300.
The descendants of Zebulun by their families were: from Sered, the family of the Seredites; from Elon, the family of the Elonites; from Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.
These were the families of the Zebulunites, and those counted were 60,500.
The descendants of Joseph by their families were Manasseh and Ephraim.
The descendants of Manasseh: from Machir, the family of the Machirites; Machir was the father of Gilead: from Gilead, the family of the Gileadites.
These were the descendants of Gilead: from Iezer, the family of the Iezerites; from Helek, the family of the Helekites;
from Asriel, the family of the Asrielites; from Shechem, the family of the Shechemites;
from Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites; from Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.
Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, had no sons, only daughters; and the names of Zelophehad's daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
These were the families of Manasseh, and those counted were 52,700.
These were the descendants of Ephraim by their families: from Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthelahites; from Becher, the family of the Becherites; from Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.
These were the descendants of Shuthelah: from Eran, the family of the Eranites.
These were the families of the sons of Ephraim, and those counted were 32,500. These were the descendants of Joseph by their families.
The descendants of Benjamin by their families were: from Bela, the family of the Belaites; from Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites; from Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites;
from Shephupham, the family of the Shuphamites; from Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.
The descendants of Bela were Ard and Naaman: from Ard, the family of the Ardites; from Naaman, the family of the Naamites.
These were the families of Benjamin, and those counted were 45,600.
These were the descendants of Dan by their families: from Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These were the families of Dan.
All the families of the Shuhamites, and those counted were 64,400.
The descendants of Asher by their families were: from Imnah, the family of the Imnites; from Ishvi, the family of the Ishvites; from Beriah, the family of the Beriites.
From the descendants of Beriah: from Heber, the family of the Heberites; from Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites.
Asher had a daughter named Serah.
These were the families of the sons of Asher, and those counted were 53,400.
The descendants of Naphtali by their families were: from Jahzeel, the family of the Jahzeelites; from Guni, the family of the Gunites;
from Jezer, the family of the Jezerites; from Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.
These were the families of Naphtali by their families, and those counted were 45,400.
The total number of the Israelites counted was 601,730.
The Lord then instructed Moses,
“The land shall be divided among them as an inheritance according to the number of names.
To a larger group give a larger inheritance, and to a smaller group a smaller one; each shall receive its inheritance according to the number of those listed.
Ensure that the land is distributed by lot. What each group inherits will be according to the names of their ancestral tribes.
The inheritance is to be distributed by lot among the larger and smaller groups.
These were the Levites who were counted by their families: from Gershon, the family of the Gershonites; from Kohath, the family of the Kohathites; from Merari, the family of the Merarites.

These also were Levite families: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, and the family of the Korahites. Kohath was the father of Amram.
The name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed, a daughter of Levi, who was born to the Levites in Egypt. To Amram she bore Aaron, Moses, and their sister Miriam.
Aaron's sons were Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
But Nadab and Abihu died when they offered unauthorised fire before the Lord.
All the male Levites from a month old and upwards numbered 23,000. They were not counted among the other Israelites because they received no inheritance among them.
These are the ones recorded by Moses and Eleazar the priest when they counted the Israelites on the plains of Moab by the Jordan opposite Jericho.
Among these, there was not a man of those who were counted by Moses and Aaron the priest when they counted the Israelites in the wilderness of Sinai.
For the Lord had said of them, “They shall surely die in the wilderness.” Not one of them was left, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.
